Description: Pale-red pottery ostracon, from the body of a vessel, interior slightly grooved and covered with traces of a dark-brown deposit, exterior with traces of a light-brown slip and remains of eight lines of black-painted demotic text recording part of a temple oath.
Curator's comments: The text is a temple oath regarding the the theft of a qbA-vessel and other items from the tomb of a woman, whose name has not survived. The accused says that he did not steal the items nor did he order the items to be stolen. He also states that he does not know who stole them. Published in: Regulski, I. (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, p. 20
Bibliographic references: Kaplony-Heckel 1963a / Die demotischen Tempeleide I: Text (p.315)
Kaplony-Heckel 1963b / Die demotischen Tempeleide II: Abbildungen (p.176)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (477) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/477)
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased through: R J Moss & Co
